{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3144000,"name":"Greg Sesny retired 5804","username":"gsesny","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gsesny/{size}/65722_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-12T02:30:22.221Z","cooked":"

All,

We are seeing a consistent error with one of our swerve modules. (Please note we are using the 364 Swerve Template). The same module most of the time does not in our belief get the absolute position at initialization. Today we checked the selftest on the Phoenix Tuner and saw the error on the Turning Falcon “Remote Sensor is missing on bus” (If I remember correctly). In our attempt to debug we did a button binding to reset absolute position. This cured the problem every single time. In our code we are using a method (from 346) to wait to reset the absolute position in order to solve the invert problem brought about from using mk4i. Does anyone have any idea of what is going on. I am beginning to think we might have a hardware issue with that Cancoder as it is the problem is always the same module.

Edit: We are using a canivore for all of our motors. The can bus length is about 25-30 feet, maybe a bit more. We are using a pigeon 2 and have not upgraded it to the latest firm ware yet.
